TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant is the father of a son born out of wedlock on DATE . Shortly after the child was born , the mother refused the applicant any contact with the child . In DATE the applicant unsuccessfully attempted to establish contact with his son .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a request for the regulation of contact rights with the GPE / ORG ( ORG ) . On CARDINAL DATE the court served the request on the mother and requested ORG to submit comments , which were submitted on DATE , following a reminder by the court . On DATE the court scheduled a hearing for DATE , which was postponed at both parties’ request to DATE .

It further decided to issue a decision on contact rights after having been informed about the concrete dates for contacts .

Both ORG and the counsel centre did not have any objections to contacts between father and son . The next step should be to limit the supervision to the accompanied handover of the child . However , having regard to the mother ’s opposition , ORG was not in a position to propose how contact rights should be established .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared that it did not have any objections to further contacts . On DATE the applicant requested the applicant to hold a hearing on his interim request .

On DATE the applicant submitted that he had appeared in time , but that the expert had not opened the door . He requested the court to terminate the examination without his cooperation , as he had lost confidence in the expert .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant had his last contact with his son .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a third hearing . While the expert recommended the continuation of supervised contacts , ORG declared that it was difficult to find an institution to supervise the contacts and recommended a suspension of contact rights .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the parties about its intention to appoint a curator ad litem to represent the child ’s interests . On DATE the parties objected . On DATE the court appointed a curator ad litem and asked her to submit comments within DATE . Both parties lodged complaints against the appointment which were withdrawn on CARDINAL and DATE , respectively .

CARDINAL . DATE the curator informed the court about her attempts to institute contact visits . During DATE , the curator and ORG attempted to induce the parties to conclude a parental agreement on the modalities of supervised contacts .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to issue a decision . On CARDINAL DATE ORG informed the parties that the parents had concluded an agreement on contacts which should be executed within a short period of time . On DATE ORG informed the parties that the proceedings were suspended as long as the agreement on contact rights was executed . On DATE ORG informed the court that supervised visits could be envisaged for DATE .

On CARDINAL DATE ORG submitted the final report by the supervising institution dated DATE , according to which the mother had failed to support the exercise of contact rights .

CARDINAL . On DATE the mother requested the court to hold a hearing . On DATE the applicant , represented by new counsel , filed extensive submissions , and requested the court to issue an interim order and to schedule a hearing . On DATE ORG scheduled a hearing for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , represented by counsel , lodged a constitutional complaint , complaining about the length of the proceedings and about the lack of an effective remedy .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the court to re - schedule the hearing because of his holiday plans . On CARDINAL DATE the court postponed the hearing to DATE . On DATE the court postponed the hearing to CARDINAL DATE in order to take into account the absence of the competent person in ORG . On DATE ORG declared the applicant ’s complaint against the postponement inadmissible . On DATE ORG , upon the mother ’s request , further postponed the hearing to DATE . On DATE ORG postponed the hearing to DATE because of the absence of the curator ad litem .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on CARDINAL DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaint against the further postponement , as the scheduling of a hearing was not subject to a legal remedy . With regard to the length of the proceedings , ORG found as follows :

“ In the instant case , the numerous postponements have created a situation which is unacceptable in the light of the requirement to expedite the proceedings ... Contact proceedings have been pending since DATE . Contacts have taken place sporadically only ; a final decision has not been given . On DATE the applicant requested the issue of an interim order . The repeated postponements of the hearing cause a factual delay which amounts to a denial of justice or a suspension of the proceedings . ”
ORG noted , however , that it was not competent to order ORG to hold the hearing on a specific date .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG postponed the hearing upon the curator ’s request to DATE . On DATE the hearing took place , on CARDINAL DATE the court heard the child .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following further submissions filed by the parents and by ORG , ORG suspended the applicant ’s contact rights for DATE . ORG considered that the child , who last saw his father DATE before , and had been burdened by the proceedings , had to be given time , inter alia to cope with his entry into school .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a motion with ORG to amend its decision of DATE with respect to the father ’s right to be informed about the child ’s personal circumstances . On DATE ORG decided on this request .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) . By interim decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG , having held a hearing on DATE , ordered CARDINAL contact visits to take place DATE . In DATE , the main proceedings were still pending before ORG .

CARDINAL . As from DATE , proceedings in family matters are governed by LAW Contentious Matters ( PERSON über PERSON in GPE in GPE der freiwilligen PERSON ) , section CARDINAL of which reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) ORG and child matters referring to the child ’s place of abode , access rights or the surrender of the child , as well as proceedings based on a threat to the child ’s welfare must be conducted as a matter of priority and expediently .

( CARDINAL ) NORP In proceedings pursuant to subsection ( CARDINAL ) the court shall discuss the case with the parties at a hearing . The hearing shall take place at DATE after the proceedings have been instituted . The court shall hear ORG during this hearing . This hearing may only be postponed for compelling reasons . Proof of the reasons for the need for the postponement must be furnished when the request for the postponement is made .
( CARDINAL ) The court shall order the parties ... to appear in person at the hearing . ”
